subject: Automated XML Validation with JUnit?
msgSnippet: Hi, I would like to integrate validation of XML files in JUnit Tests. It would be cool to just point to a directory of xml files, provide a schema and then
messageBody:
Hi,

I would like to integrate validation of XML files in JUnit Tests.

It would be cool to just point to a directory of xml files, provide a schema and then have for each schema a testcase generated, with one method for each xml instance file.

Something like this:
- car.xsd
--- gm.xml (assertion failed: attribute missing bla bla)
--- toyota.xml (ok)
- opera.rng
--- der_ring_des_nibelungen.xml (ok)
--- la_traviata.xml (ok)

This would allow for a comprehensive and compact display of the validation, e.g. in eclipse or on a test-server, performing daily unit tests and producing output in a well-known fashion.

Google does not seem to help much. Does someone know of such a tool?

All the best,
Murat
